Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Upgrading to 3+ can be troublesome for .NET6 projects" (#1689) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
The transition from 2.20 to 3.0 changed the dependency on [System.IO.Packaging](https://www.nuget.org/packages/System.IO.Packaging/) from `>=4.7.0` to `>=8.0.0`. For .NET6 projects its troublesome to use System.* packages with different major versions meaning upgrading to 3.0 is cumbersome (maybe impossible depending on how the dependency graph looks).

Was this change made intentionally to get access to newer APIs and if not can the dependency requirement at least be lowered to the lowest supported .NET version (e.g. 6.0.0)? If the change was intentional and the package now depends on new APIs introduced in 8.0.0 then feel free to close.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Bump danielpalme/ReportGenerator-GitHub-Action from 5.2.2 to 5.2.4" (#1699) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
Bumps [danielpalme/ReportGenerator-GitHub-Action](https://github.com/danielpalme/reportgenerator-github-action) from 5.2.2 to 5.2.4.
Release notes

Sourced from danielpalme/ReportGenerator-GitHub-Action's releases.

5.2.4

-#630 Added "raw mode" (settings:rawMode=true) to disable that coverage data of nested or compiler generated classes is included in the parent class. This is useful to merge several Cobertura files into a single file.

5.2.3

  • #656 Changed handling of files which are not found in source directory

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Investigate changing extensionlist/extension mechanism naming to more closely match Office use" (#1697) at dotnet/Open-XML-SDK
Events.RelatedBody:
There are two things that may be confusing and/or incorrect about our use of extensionlist/extension mechanism: 

1. When Office team provides CT_ExtensionList and CT_Extension types in xsd definitions, we have been using specialized CT_<feature>ExtensionList/CT_<feature>Extension types to map these. The reason goes back to early days where it was confusing and difficult to just use CT_ExtensionList for all the features due to name collisions. However, it's possible we could have handled this differently. The CT_Extension class makes use of uri attributes to associate each extension for specific features.
This would of course be a breaking change and would require refactoring any code using the extensions.

2. Our use of the uri attributes has not been consistent and some cleanup is likely needed there. This may also involve coordination with our Open Specifications extension documentation as some guids used as uri may not be listed.
